interaction.title: The fastest tennis serve was Samuel Groth at 163.7 mph (73 m/s). The mass of a tennis ball is 58.5 grams (0.0585 kg). Calculate the amount of energy in the tennis balls kinetic energy store to 2 decimal places.

The fastest baseball pitch was thrown by Aroldis Chapman at 105.1 mph (47 m/s). The mass of a baseball is 145 grams (0.145 kg). Calculate the amount of energy in the baseballs kinetic energy store to 2 decimal places.
A cheetah weighs in at 45 kilograms and can run at 33 metres per second. What is a cheetah’s kinetic energy store to 2 decimal places?

The current record for fastest road car is the Koenigsegg Agera RS and has been clocked at 277.87 mph (128.7 m/s). It weighs in at 1,395 kg. Calculate it’s kinetic energy store at top speed to 2 decimal places!

You may need a scientific calculator for this one… The Ceres asteroid is the largest object in the asteroid belt. It’s mass is 939,300x1015 kg and it’s travelling at 17.9 km/s. Calculate it’s kinetic energy store to 2 decimal places. (hint: there’s 1,000 metres in 1 km). To make things easier, the answer will be x10^45
